original_text:
Mayan Temple Revenge
Chiunque sia avvezzo del mondo delle slot online sa benissimo quanto l’epoca delle popolazioni precolombiane sia un tema molto caro per i produttori di giochi di questo tipo. D’altronde non deve sorprendere: gli Inca, i Maya e gli Aztechi da sempre fanno parte dell’immaginario comune per il fascino che esercitano con le loro culture e per la corsa all’oro dei conquistadores alla ricerca di El Dorado.
Non sorprende quindi vedere questo tema applicato a una o più slot della stessa casa, come la Capecod, e la nascita di slot quali Mayan Temple Revenge.
Andiamo a vedere velocemente cosa ha da offrire questa slot.

Mayan Temple Revenge: comparto visivo
Da un punto di vista prettamente grafico, la slot cerca di unire lo stile storico con simboli che richiamano al luogo di appartenenza del tema a uno stile più moderno fatto di colori e luce. Troviamo quindi simboli relativi ai totem e templi maya, ma anche luci al neon e simboli delle carte da gioco (A, K, Q…) colorati. Sebbene questo connubio, sulla carta, possa sembrare non dei migliori, in realtà la slot dimostra essere piacevole da giocare.
Un unico appunto: il comparto sonoro. Nelle fasi tra una giocata e l’altra veniamo accompagnati da delle percussioni in sottofondo che rendono il gioco accattivante. Il problema sorge durante le stesse giocate, quando il volume di questi tamburi si fa decisamente più pronunciato, per questo motivo è consigliabile prevenire il tutto abbassando l’audio del dispositivo prima di cominciare a giocare.

Mayan Temple Revenge: meccaniche di gioco
Passiamo all’aspetto tecnico di questa slot: come al solito ci troviamo di fronte a un titolo che sfrutta il comunissimo meccanismo 5*3, come la maggior parte delle slot online della Capecod (anche se in questo caso si parla di una collaborazione con la Elsy).
L’RTP, ovvero il ritorno per giocatore, è di poco superiore al 94%, meno rispetto alla media del 95% di questa casa produttrice. L’RTP, nel caso il lettore non sapesse di cosa stiamo parlando, è la percentuale di soldi emessi in forma di vincita rispetto a quelli immessi in forma di puntata. Un RTP del 94% indica che per ogni 100€ giocati (in media) vengono rilasciati 94€ in forma di vincita.
Passando ai simboli che è possibile trovare nella griglia di gioco, il Re è quello dal maggior valore, al quale vanno aggiunti i simboli dotati di una funzione speciale. Come in altri titoli della Capecod, anche in questo caso parliamo di ben due simboli Wild: il Joker è semplicemente un Jolly che può sostituire qualsiasi altro simbolo nella schermata di gioco, mentre il Wild si estende su tutta la colonna di gioco, quindi può essere considerato come tre Joker uno sopra l’altro.
Ci sono inoltre due simboli speciali (Scatter) che danno accesso alla modalità bonus del gioco, tutte funzioni che permettono di avere un numero interessante di vincite nonostante l’RTP leggermente inferiore alla media.

Slot simili a Mayan Temple Revenge
Il popolo Maya da sempre affolla il mondo delle slot online. Possiamo parlare di diversi titoli affini, come ad esempio Mayan Riches della IGT, Diego Fortune della Booongo o ancora Temple Quest della Microgaming.

raw_translation.response:
Mayan Temple Revenge:
For any experienced gambler in the world of online slots, it is well known that the era of pre-Columbian populations is a popular theme for game producers of this genre. It is not surprising, as the Inca, Maya, and Aztecs have always been part of the collective imagination for the charm exerted by their cultures and the search for gold by the conquerors in search of El Dorado.

It is therefore not surprising to see this theme applied to one or more slots from the same producer, such as Capecod, and the birth of slots like Mayan Temple Revenge.
Let's quickly see what this slot has to offer.

Mayan Temple Revenge: visual aspect
From a purely graphic point of view, the slot tries to combine the historical style with symbols that refer to the place of belonging of the theme to a more modern style made of colors and light. We find symbols related to Mayan totems and temples, but also neon lights and playing card symbols (A, K, Q...) in colorful shades. Although this combination, on paper, may not seem the best, in reality, the slot proves to be pleasant to play.
One caveat: the sound department. In between spins, we are accompanied by background percussion that makes the game captivating. The problem arises during the spins themselves when the volume of these drums becomes decidedly louder, so it is advisable to lower the device's audio before starting to play.

Mayan Temple Revenge: gameplay mechanics
Let's move on to the technical aspect of this slot: as usual, we are faced with a title that exploits the common mechanism of 5*3, like most online slots by Capecod (although in this case, it is a collaboration with Elsy).
The RTP, that is, the return to player, is slightly above 94%, less than the 95% average of this producer. The RTP, in case the reader is not familiar with what we are talking about, is the percentage of money emitted in the form of winnings compared to those issued in the form of bets. An RTP of 94% means that for every €100 played (on average), €94 are released in the form of winnings.
Moving on to the symbols that can be found on the game grid, the King is the one with the highest value, to which symbols with a special function must be added. As in other Capecod titles, we are also talking about two Wild symbols in this case: the Joker is simply a wild card that can replace any other symbol on the game screen, while the Wild expands across the whole game column, so it can be considered as three Jokers stacked on top of each other.
In addition, there are two special symbols (Scatter) that give access to the game's bonus mode, all functions that allow for an interesting number of wins despite the slightly below average RTP.

Slots similar to Mayan Temple Revenge
The Mayan people have always inhabited the world of online slots. We can talk about different related titles, such as Mayan Riches by IGT, Diego Fortune by Booongo, or even Temple Quest by Microgaming.

raw_translation.response:
Those who are familiar with the world of online slots know how dear the pre-Columbian era theme is to the producers of these types of games. It's no surprise really, as the Incas, Mayas, and Aztecs have always been part of popular culture due to the allure of their cultures and the conquistadores' pursuit of El Dorado. It's not surprising, therefore, to see this theme applied to one or more slots by the same house, such as Capecod, giving rise to slots such as Mayan Temple Revenge.

Let's take a quick look at what this slot has to offer.
Visually, the slot combines historical style with symbols that evoke the place of origin of the theme in a more modern style of colors and light. We find symbols related to Mayan totems and temples, but also neon lights and colorful playing card symbols (A, K, Q...). Although this combination may not seem the best on paper, the slot proves to be enjoyable to play.
There is one note, however, concerning the sound department. During gaming, there are percussions in the background making the game catchy, but during the play itself, these drums become too loud. Therefore, it is advisable to lower the audio of the device before starting to play.

In technical terms, this slot uses the common 5x3 reel mechanism, like most online slots from Capecod (although in this case they collaborate with Elsy). The RTP, or player's return, is slightly above 94%, less than the average of 95% for this manufacturer. The RTP is the percentage of money issued in the form of a win compared to the amount wagered. An RTP of 94% indicates that for every 100€ played (on average), 94€ is won.

The King symbol holds the highest value, and there are also two special symbols (Scatter) that give access to the bonus mode of the game. The Joker is a wild symbol that can substitute for any other symbol on the game screen, while the Wild expands throughout the reel, making it like having three Jokers stacked on top of each other. These functions allow for an interesting number of wins despite the slightly lower RTP than the average.

Mayan Temple Revenge is not the only slot game that uses this theme. There are similar titles, such as Mayan Riches by IGT, Diego Fortune by Booongo, and Temple Quest by Microgaming. As an experienced gambler, this slot provides an enjoyable gaming experience with unique features and the accompanying factors that make it a fun and exciting game to play.

message.content:
Those who are familiar with the world of online slots know how dear the pre-Columbian era theme is to the producers of these types of games. It's no surprise really, as the Incas, Mayas, and Aztecs have always been part of popular culture due to the allure of their cultures and the conquistadores' pursuit of El Dorado. It's not surprising, therefore, to see this theme applied to one or more slots by the same house, such as Capecod, giving rise to slots such as Mayan Temple Revenge.

Let's take a quick look at what this slot has to offer.
Visually, the slot combines historical style with symbols that evoke the place of origin of the theme in a more modern style of colors and light. We find symbols related to Mayan totems and temples, but also neon lights and colorful playing card symbols (A, K, Q...). Although this combination may not seem the best on paper, the slot proves to be enjoyable to play.
There is one note, however, concerning the sound department. During gaming, there are percussions in the background making the game catchy, but during the play itself, these drums become too loud. Therefore, it is advisable to lower the audio of the device before starting to play.

In technical terms, this slot uses the common 5x3 reel mechanism, like most online slots from Capecod (although in this case they collaborate with Elsy). The RTP, or player's return, is slightly above 94%, less than the average of 95% for this manufacturer. The RTP is the percentage of money issued in the form of a win compared to the amount wagered. An RTP of 94% indicates that for every 100€ played (on average), 94€ is won.

The King symbol holds the highest value, and there are also two special symbols (Scatter) that give access to the bonus mode of the game. The Joker is a wild symbol that can substitute for any other symbol on the game screen, while the Wild expands throughout the reel, making it like having three Jokers stacked on top of each other. These functions allow for an interesting number of wins despite the slightly lower RTP than the average.

Mayan Temple Revenge is not the only slot game that uses this theme. There are similar titles, such as Mayan Riches by IGT, Diego Fortune by Booongo, and Temple Quest by Microgaming. As an experienced gambler, this slot provides an enjoyable gaming experience with unique features and the accompanying factors that make it a fun and exciting game to play.

raw_translation_without_faq.response:
Mayan Temple Revenge is a popular online slot game that draws inspiration from the ancient cultures of the Maya, Aztecs, and Incas. Developed by Capecod and Elsy, the slot adopts a modern coloring style while still incorporating the symbols and motifs of the pre-Columbian era.

The game has a standard 5x3 format and average RTP of just above 94%. Players can expect to find traditional and neon styled symbols, including playing card symbols along with Mayan totems and temples. The percussion soundtrack adds to the overall ambiance but may require the volume to be lowered during gameplay.

Mayan Temple Revenge offers two Wild symbols, the Joker and an expanding Wild, along with two Scatter symbols that trigger the game's bonus mode. While the RTP falls slightly below the average for Capecod slots, there are still plenty of opportunities to win big.

Other online slots with similar themes include Mayan Riches by IGT, Diego Fortune by Booongo, and Temple Quest by Microgaming.

Review: Mayan Temple Revenge:
For any experienced gambler in the world of online slots, it is well known that the era of pre-Columbian populations is a popular theme for game producers of this genre. It is not surprising, as the Inca, Maya, and Aztecs have always been part of the collective imagination for the charm exerted by their cultures and the search for gold by the conquerors in search of El Dorado.

It is therefore not surprising to see this theme applied to one or more slots from the same producer, such as Capecod, and the birth of slots like Mayan Temple Revenge.
Let's quickly see what this slot has to offer.

Mayan Temple Revenge: visual aspect
From a purely graphic point of view, the slot tries to combine the historical style with symbols that refer to the place of belonging of the theme to a more modern style made of colors and light. We find symbols related to Mayan totems and temples, but also neon lights and playing card symbols (A, K, Q...) in colorful shades. Although this combination, on paper, may not seem the best, in reality, the slot proves to be pleasant to play.
One caveat: the sound department. In between spins, we are accompanied by background percussion that makes the game captivating. The problem arises during the spins themselves when the volume of these drums becomes decidedly louder, so it is advisable to lower the device's audio before starting to play.

Mayan Temple Revenge: gameplay mechanics
Let's move on to the technical aspect of this slot: as usual, we are faced with a title that exploits the common mechanism of 5*3, like most online slots by Capecod (although in this case, it is a collaboration with Elsy).
The RTP, that is, the return to player, is slightly above 94%, less than the 95% average of this producer. The RTP, in case the reader is not familiar with what we are talking about, is the percentage of money emitted in the form of winnings compared to those issued in the form of bets. An RTP of 94% means that for every €100 played (on average), €94 are released in the form of winnings.
Moving on to the symbols that can be found on the game grid, the King is the one with the highest value, to which symbols with a special function must be added. As in other Capecod titles, we are also talking about two Wild symbols in this case: the Joker is simply a wild card that can replace any other symbol on the game screen, while the Wild expands across the whole game column, so it can be considered as three Jokers stacked on top of each other.
In addition, there are two special symbols (Scatter) that give access to the game's bonus mode, all functions that allow for an interesting number of wins despite the slightly below average RTP.

Slots similar to Mayan Temple Revenge
The Mayan people have always inhabited the world of online slots. We can talk about different related titles, such as Mayan Riches by IGT, Diego Fortune by Booongo, or even Temple Quest by Microgaming.

Review: Mayan Temple Revenge:
For any experienced gambler in the world of online slots, it is well known that the era of pre-Columbian populations is a popular theme for game producers of this genre. It is not surprising, as the Inca, Maya, and Aztecs have always been part of the collective imagination for the charm exerted by their cultures and the search for gold by the conquerors in search of El Dorado.

It is therefore not surprising to see this theme applied to one or more slots from the same producer, such as Capecod, and the birth of slots like Mayan Temple Revenge.
Let's quickly see what this slot has to offer.

Mayan Temple Revenge: visual aspect
From a purely graphic point of view, the slot tries to combine the historical style with symbols that refer to the place of belonging of the theme to a more modern style made of colors and light. We find symbols related to Mayan totems and temples, but also neon lights and playing card symbols (A, K, Q...) in colorful shades. Although this combination, on paper, may not seem the best, in reality, the slot proves to be pleasant to play.
One caveat: the sound department. In between spins, we are accompanied by background percussion that makes the game captivating. The problem arises during the spins themselves when the volume of these drums becomes decidedly louder, so it is advisable to lower the device's audio before starting to play.

Mayan Temple Revenge: gameplay mechanics
Let's move on to the technical aspect of this slot: as usual, we are faced with a title that exploits the common mechanism of 5*3, like most online slots by Capecod (although in this case, it is a collaboration with Elsy).
The RTP, that is, the return to player, is slightly above 94%, less than the 95% average of this producer. The RTP, in case the reader is not familiar with what we are talking about, is the percentage of money emitted in the form of winnings compared to those issued in the form of bets. An RTP of 94% means that for every €100 played (on average), €94 are released in the form of winnings.
Moving on to the symbols that can be found on the game grid, the King is the one with the highest value, to which symbols with a special function must be added. As in other Capecod titles, we are also talking about two Wild symbols in this case: the Joker is simply a wild card that can replace any other symbol on the game screen, while the Wild expands across the whole game column, so it can be considered as three Jokers stacked on top of each other.
In addition, there are two special symbols (Scatter) that give access to the game's bonus mode, all functions that allow for an interesting number of wins despite the slightly below average RTP.

Slots similar to Mayan Temple Revenge
The Mayan people have always inhabited the world of online slots. We can talk about different related titles, such as Mayan Riches by IGT, Diego Fortune by Booongo, or even Temple Quest by Microgaming.
